Posts.Content: Hopefully once you see the consultant and get your results - and hopefully that'll be the end of it for you - then things may start to get a little brighter for you.  I hope so.  You may be feeling a bit shellshocked about the tests and surgery - it is a rollercoaster - you need time to process it all.  Don't be so hard on yourself. Cwtches xx
Posts.Title: Emotions- can anyone relate?

Posts.Content: I've only had 3 out of 15 sessions of radiotherapy and my head is constantly pounding and really dizzy like I've had too much alcohol even though I haven't had any. Has anyone else experienced this?  Cwtches
Posts.Title: Headache / dizzy & radiotherapy

Posts.Content: I drink loads of water so I'd be surprised if it was dehydration. Maybe it's not the radiotherapy and it just happened to start at the same time. It's horrid though - I don't drink alcohol or caffeine - it's constant. Cwtches :-)
Posts.Title: Headache / dizzy & radiotherapy

Posts.Content: I'm relieved that it probably isn't radio and is probably a coincidence as I was really nervous about the next 13 sessions.  I'll see how it goes - perhaps I've got an ear infection. I blame everything on my treatment - usually chemo gets the blame!  Thank you Cwtches
Posts.Title: Headache / dizzy & radiotherapy

Posts.Content: A friend of mine bought me a V shaped pillow (like people use for breast feeding) - this helped me no end
Posts.Title: 5 Days post op - tips on sleeping with drain!

Posts.Content: Thank you for your responses - it seems that it is down to the surgeon then?  There is no hard and fast rules.  I've been told my BMI needs to be 25 which means about 4 stone loss for me - it'll need to be done a year after my mastectomy as well and be considered just cosmetic surgery - which I understand to an extent.  I've seen picture on line of women who are around the same size as me having had it so again assume this is down to the surgeon or perhaps the hospital - surely it's better to be a little overweight so you have some abdominal fat to use?  I've called the breast care team to see what is happening as I'm waiting to see a surgeon to make a decision - but if it's down to the individual surgeons then a years time it could all change again??
Posts.Title: DIEP after C-Sections

Posts.Content: Hi Keza1 - I saw plastic surgeon who advised me that I could have diep despite two c-sections so fingers crossed you'll get the result you want.  I couldn't have immediate diep - apparently because it is major delicate surgery and the potential impact that radiotherapy could have they tend not to do it immediately.  So I'm now wonky - but cancer free which is the most important bit :-)
Posts.Title: DIEP after C-Sections

Posts.Content: Due to have mastectomy - anyone have experience of having a DIEP reconstruction when previously had C-Section.  My daughter is 13 now so not a new section by any means.  Also, were there issues if your BMI was over 25 i.e. overweight?
Posts.Title: DIEP after C-Sections

Posts.Content: Had mastectomy a couple of weeks ago - plus node clearance.  Didn't have any kind of reconstruction in the end - will have diep early next year.  I do need to lose weight to enable it to go ahead - but arguably I should anyway as it's not healthy!  Next stop for me is radiotherapy.   Sending cwtches :)
Posts.Title: DIEP after C-Sections

Posts.Content: Hi Had my first FEC chemo last Thursday and I'm having a hell of a headache still a week later - mainly in the evenings. Tablets don't seem to touch it. It's so painful.  Anyone else had this? Cancer clinic sent me to the gp as I shouldn't be having these now but the gp didn't seem to understand chemo or side effects and was quite unhelpful Any advice gratefully received
Posts.Title: Hellish Headache

Posts.Content: Hi  Thank you for responding.  The dr prescribed cocodamol (spelt woefully wrong) which is quite strong. It takes the edge off it. I'll call the clinic again today to see what they say. Cheers :-)
Posts.Title: Hellish Headache

Posts.Content: I've just started a post about lower back / hip pain - I hadn't twigged about the connection with tamoxifen - been on it since June and each time I get a prescription it's a different make - I've nearly finished this pack so I'll make a note that I get joint pain and see what brand the next lot are!!   It never comes to an end does it :-(
Posts.Title: Is there an alternative to Tamoxifen?
